page.title: 14Brookmans Pk.BBC Transmitter
page.content: The BBC Transmitter Station dominates our area.It occupies 64 acres of land.It was opened on 14th October 1929. This site was chosen because it is the highest point of land between York and Russia. The station transmits radio signals only.The services transmitted are Radio 1,2,3 and Radio London. The receiving area extends from Gloucester to Suffolk. The station has masts and towers.The highest mast is 500ft.Masts are supported by stay wires.Towers have four legs and are self_ supporting.They are expected to last 50 years.Ready to assemble tower kits are kept at the station in case of storm damage. The aerials can be seen from miles around.
